intro: Comolia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved comolia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
